title: Type designers wifes!
content:
I'm came accross a few typedesigner who named fonts after their wife. Thought this was a quite funny collection! I had to think about Gills Joanna, or Churchwards Marianna. Does anyone know any more?

Thanks!
author: Brown Fox

comments.content:
Uh, Joanna was Gill's <cite>daughter</cite>. Although...

hhp
Oh, you're right! I got that wrong with Joanna, his daugther is in fact called Joan. Thanks for correcting me.
hrant, right on. With Gill, anything's possible.
[PMN Caecilia](http://web.archive.org/web/20110322094133/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/pmn-caecilia/) by Peter Matthias Noordzij, called after his wife Cécile.
[Ela](http://web.archive.org/web/20110322094133/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/ela/familytree.html) was designed by Gert Wiescher and named after his wife, Micha_ela_.
You'll have to ask Sander Wolf the reason he named [Sticky Annie](http://web.archive.org/web/20110322094133/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sanders/sticky-annie/) after his wife.

You guys can't leave a chance of making a pun on Gill jajaja...

Héctor
I always wanted to know who [Lilith](http://web.archive.org/web/20110322094133/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/annabelle-matinee-nf/familytree.html)was named after.

Another interesting case is Mrs Eaves:

<cite>This typeface is named after Sarah Eaves, the woman who became John Baskerville’s wife. As Baskerville was setting up his printing and type business, Mrs. Eaves moved in with him as a live-in housekeeper, eventually becoming his wife after the death of her first husband, Mr. Eaves. Like the widows of Caslon, Bodoni, and the daughters of Fournier, Sarah similarly completed the printing of the unfinished volumes that John Baskerville left upon his death.</cite> (from [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mrs-eaves/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110322094133/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mrs-eaves/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mrs-eaves/"))
